reference: Burkard, R., Dell'Amico, M., & Martello, S. (2012). Assignment Problems (Revised reprint). Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics.
math_formula:
### Mathematical Model
Let P be the set of peaks and A be the set of amino acids:

#### Parameters:
- c_{i,j}: Cost of assigning peak i to amino acid j
- N: Number of required assignments
- NTH: Distance threshold for NOE relation
- d_{k,l}: Distance between amino acids k and l
- b_{k,l}: Binary parameter (1 if d_{k,l} < NTH, 0 otherwise)
- NOE_i: Set of peaks with NOE relation to peak i

#### Variables:
- x_{i,j}: Binary variable (1 if peak i is assigned to amino acid j, 0 otherwise)

$$
\begin{aligned}
&\text{Minimize} && \sum_{i \in P}\sum_{j \in A} c_{i,j}x_{i,j} \\
&\text{Subject to:} && \sum_{i \in P} x_{i,j} \leq 1 && \forall j \in A \\
& && \sum_{i \in A} x_{i,j} \leq 1 && \forall j \in P \\
& && \sum_{i \in P}\sum_{j \in A} x_{i,j} = N \\
& && x_{i,j} + x_{k,l} \leq b_{j,l} + 1 && \forall j,l \in A, i \in P, k \in NOE_i \\
& && x_{i,j} \in \{0,1\} && \forall i \in P, j \in A
\end{aligned}
$$
natural_language_example:
Consider a Nuclear Magnetic Resonance (NMR) spectroscopy experiment where:
* There are 10 peaks detected in the NMR spectrum
* There are 12 amino acids in the protein sequence
* Each peak must be matched to at most one amino acid
* Each amino acid can be matched to at most one peak
* Exactly 8 assignments must be made
* Some peaks have NOE relations with other peaks (indicating they are spatially close)
* Some amino acids are within the distance threshold of other amino acids

For example:
* Peak 1 has an NOE relation with Peak 2
* Amino acids A and B are 3Å apart (below the 5Å threshold)
* Cost of assigning Peak 1 to amino acid A is 0.2
* Cost of assigning Peak 1 to amino acid B is 0.8

The goal is to find the assignment of peaks to amino acids that minimizes the total assignment cost while respecting the NOE constraints.
